channel.title: CVE Feed for PostgreSQL -- PostgreSQL
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PostgreSQL -- PostgreSQL

item.title: CVE-2017-7548|2024-08-05T16:04:12.013Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: PostgreSQL versions before 9.4.13, 9.5.8 and 9.6.4 are vulnerable to authorization flaw allowing remote authenticated attackers with no privileges on a large object to overwrite the entire contents of the object, resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2017-7547|2024-08-05T16:04:11.996Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: PostgreSQL versions before 9.2.22, 9.3.18, 9.4.13, 9.5.8 and 9.6.4 are vulnerable to authorization flaw allowing remote authenticated attackers to retrieve passwords from the user mappings defined by the foreign server owners without actually having the privileges to do so.

item.title: CVE-2017-7546|2024-08-05T16:04:12.029Z -- postgresql -- postgresql
item.description: PostgreSQL versions before 9.2.22, 9.3.18, 9.4.13, 9.5.8 and 9.6.4 are vulnerable to incorrect authentication flaw allowing remote attackers to gain access to database accounts with an empty password.
